curam.util.type

Class DateRange

  • java.lang.Object
    • curam.util.type.DateRange
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.lang.Comparable<DateRange>

    public class DateRange
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.lang.Comparable<DateRange>
    Holds a period of time bounded by a start date and end date. The start date is optional. If no start date is specified, then the date range runs from "the beginning of time". If the start date is specified, then the date range covers the start date but not the day before, i.e. the start date is "contained" within the date range. The start date is the first day in the date range. The end date is optional. If no end date is specified, then the date range runs to "the end of time" (or "until further notice"). If the end date is specified, then the date range covers the end date but not the day after, i.e. the end date is "contained" within the date range. The end date is the last day in the date range.

      • findContiguousDateRanges

        public static <D extends DateRanged> java.util.Set<DateRange.DateRangeSet<D>> findContiguousDateRanges(java.lang.Iterable<D> iterableDateRanged)
        Helper method to combine overlapping/contiguous date ranges into single ranges. For example, if we then entities which cover the following date ranges:
        • 1st January 2000 - 31st January 2000;
        • 1st February 2000 - 29th February 2000;
        • 15th February 2000 - 15th March 2000; and
        • 17th March 2000 onwards
        then between these entities, the following periods are "covered":
        • 1st January 2000 - 15th March 2000; and
        • 17th March 2000 onwards
        in that every date in these periods are covered by one or more entities. This method returns a set of dates ranges, each of which is contiguously covered by one or more of the entities supplied. The entities contributing to each date range are returned in a subset.
        Type Parameters:
        D - The type of entity containing a date range.
        Parameters:
        iterableDateRanged - An iterableDateRanged object containing date-range entities.
        Returns:
        A set of contiguous date ranges covered by the entities.

      • latest

        public static <D extends DateRanged> D latest(java.lang.Iterable<D> iterableDateRanged)
        Helper method to determine the latest-dated entity among the date-ranged entities passed in.
        Type Parameters:

        Parameters:
        iterableDateRanged - An iterableDateRanged object containing date-range entities.
        Returns:

        public static <D extends DateRanged> D next(java.lang.Iterable<D> iterableDateRanged,
                                            D current)

        Returns:

      • recordInEffectOn

        public static <D extends DateRanged> D recordInEffectOn(java.lang.Iterable<D> iterableDateRanged,
                                                        Date date)
                                                 throws AppRuntimeException
        Helper method to determine the single record "in effect" on a particular date. A record is "in effect" if its date range contains the date. An exception is thrown if more than one record is found to be "in effect".
        Type Parameters:
        D - The type of entity containing a date range. *
        Parameters:
        iterableDateRanged - An iterableDateRanged object containing date-range entities.
        date - The date being queried.
        Returns:
        The single records "in effect" on the date specified, or null if none found.
        Throws:
        AppRuntimeException - if more than one "in effect" record found.

      • recordsInEffectOn

        public static <D extends DateRanged> java.util.Set<D> recordsInEffectOn(java.lang.Iterable<D> iterableDateRanged,
                                                                        Date date)
        Helper method to determine the set of records "in effect" on a particular date. A record is "in effect" if its date range contains the date.
        Type Parameters:
        D - The type of entity containing a date range. *
        Parameters:
        iterableDateRanged - An iterableDateRanged object containing date-range entities.
        date - The date being queried.
        Returns:
        The set of records "in effect" on the date specified, or an empty set if none found.

        Returns:

      • todayOnwards

        public static final DateRange todayOnwards()
        Creates an open date range starting on the current business date. NB we have a static method, not a static field, as in a long-running server, the value of "todayOnwards" changes each day!
        Returns:
        An open date range starting on the current business date.

      • isValidRange

        public boolean isValidRange()
        Checks whether the date range is valid. The start date (if specified) cannot be after the end date (if specified). Note that the start date and end date are allowed to be the same date - signifying a date range which covers a single day.
        Returns:
        Whether the date range is valid.

      • length

        public int length()
        Calculates the number of days contained in the date range. A date range that starts and end on the same day contains exactly one day.
        Returns:
        The number of days contained in the date range, or -1 if the date range does not cover a valid finite range.
